ALARM_TEXT: The bridge allows users to lock their ETH in a smart contract on Ethereum and mint secretETH. Below you can unwrap your secretETH and receive ETH tokens back link.
INFO_TEXT: The bridge allows users to lock their ETH in a smart contract on Ethereum and mint secretETH. Below you can unwrap your secretETH and receive ETH tokens back link.
SETTING_DESCRIPTION: You can provide this app with access to the chosen addresses associated with your account.
ERROR_TEXT_1: Error: Returned error: insufficient funds for transfer
ERROR_DESCRIPTION_1: This error happens when you are trying to swap tokens with insufficient allowance, or when your address has insufficient funds.
ERROR_TIP_1: Check your available balance and make sure it’s sufficient. Also, ensure you’ve given the contract allowance to spend the amount of funds you're attempting to swap with.
ERROR_TEXT_2: Error: Returned error: operation is not available
ERROR_TIP_2: If the error persists, try again later
ERROR_DESCRIPTION_3: Your input amount is insufficient. It might be the case that prices are updating too fast when and your slippage tolerance is too low
ERROR_TIP_3: Increase your slippage tolerance a bit and try again.
ERROR_TIP_DEFAULT: Make sure you have more tokens in your wallet than you intend to swap, or try to swap a lower amount.
ADDRESS_ERROR_TEXT: Seems like you don't have any OSMOSIS addresses imported into
ADDRESS_ERROR_TIP: Go to 'Add address' section and import OSMOSIS addresses of your choice with private key, seed phrase or hardware wallet
NO_TRANSACTIONS_DESCRIPTION: Your transaction records with status and details will be displayed here
BOND_INFO: Due to high network congestion, we are temporarily limiting users to 2 bonding transactions per day

POOL_CREATE_CONFIRM: I understand  that creating a new pool will cost
ALARM_MODAL_TEXT: Osmosis is currently congested due to daily reward distribution, so it may experience some issues in the operation at the moment.
ALARM_MODAL_TIP: Don't worry, it's a regular procedure. Come back in approximately:

DEPOSIT_CARD.DEPOSIT_CARD_DESCRIPTION: On the main page of your address you can find a section where you can send your assets to the chosen IBC-network.
In the 'Send' section, you will see an option to send your assets to another network. Switch the toggle to access the destination network choice.
In the extended field, choose the destination network. Assets will appear as IBC assets associated with destination address.
Choose the destination address and set the amount you want to send. Once it's done, confirm it and wait for transaction to proceed.
Upon the transaction completion, your tokens will appear in the assets section in the main layout.
You can also check the assets page right inside the Citadel.one Osmosis application. Go to the 'Assets' section and see detailed information on you IBC tokens associated with the Osmosis address.
